blockEntries.name: target
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of components to include in the instantiated process. The default value 'all' includes all components that are required to form a functional Grafana Mimir instance in single-binary mode. Use the '-modules' command line flag to get a list of available components, and to see which components are included with 'all'.

blockEntries.name: multitenancy_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When set to true, incoming HTTP requests must specify tenant ID in HTTP X-Scope-OrgId header. When set to false, tenant ID from -auth.no-auth-tenant is used instead.

blockEntries.name: no_auth_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Tenant ID to use when multitenancy is disabled.

blockEntries.name: skip_label_name_validation_header_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Allows to skip label name validation via X-Mimir-SkipLabelNameValidation header on the http write path. Use with caution as it breaks PromQL. Allowing this for external clients allows any client to send invalid label names. After enabling it, requests with a specific HTTP header set to true will not have label names validated.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Alertmanager ui and api will be served.

blockEntries.name: prometheus_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Prometheus api will be served.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen network, default tcp

blockEntries.name: http_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen address.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen port.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous http connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen network

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen address.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen port.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous grpc connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: register_instrumentation
blockEntries.desc: Register the intrumentation handlers (/metrics etc).

blockEntries.name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for graceful shutdowns

blockEntries.name: http_server_read_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Read timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_server_write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Write timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_server_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Idle timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can receive (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can send (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_concurrent_streams
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the number of concurrent streams for gRPC calls (0 = unlimited)

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_idle
blockEntries.desc: The duration after which an idle connection should be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: The duration for the maximum amount of time a connection may exist before it will be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age_grace
blockEntries.desc: An additive period after max-connection-age after which the connection will be forcibly closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_time
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which a keepalive probe is sent in case of no activity over the connection., Default: 2h

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After having pinged for keepalive check, the duration after which an idle connection should be closed, Default: 20s

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_min_time_between_pings
blockEntries.desc: Minimum amount of time a client should wait before sending a keepalive ping. If client sends keepalive ping more often, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_ping_without_stream_allowed
blockEntries.desc: If true, server allows keepalive pings even when there are no active streams(RPCs). If false, and client sends ping when there are no active streams, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: log_format
blockEntries.desc: Output log messages in the given format. Valid formats: [logfmt, json]

blockEntries.name: log_level
blockEntries.desc: Only log messages with the given severity or above. Valid levels: [debug, info, warn, error]

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log the source IPs.

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_header
blockEntries.desc: Header field storing the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_regex
blockEntries.desc: Regex for matching the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: log_request_at_info_level_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log requests at info level instead of debug level.

blockEntries.name: http_path_prefix
blockEntries.desc: Base path to serve all API routes from (e.g. /v1/)

blockEntries.name: client_cleanup_period
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to clean up clients for ingesters that have gone away.

blockEntries.name: health_check_ingesters
blockEntries.desc: Run a health check on each ingester client during periodic cleanup.

blockEntries.name: enable_ha_tracker
blockEntries.desc: Enable the distributors HA tracker so that it can accept samples from Prometheus HA replicas gracefully (requires labels).

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Update the timestamp in the KV store for a given cluster/replica only after this amount of time has passed since the current stored timestamp.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout_jitter_max
blockEntries.desc: Maximum jitter applied to the update timeout, in order to spread the HA heartbeats over time.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_failover_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If we don't receive any samples from the accepted replica for a cluster in this amount of time we will failover to the next replica we receive a sample from. This value must be greater than the update timeout

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: remote_write API max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: remote_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for downstream ingesters.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix

blockEntries.name: acl_token

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: password

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which distributors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring. Default is auto-detected.

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that this distributor will accept. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this distributor can handle. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The sum of the request sizes in bytes of inflight push requests that this distributor can handle. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables the feature to forward certain metrics in remote_write requests, depending on defined rules.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for requests to ingestion endpoints to which we forward metrics.

blockEntries.name: propagate_errors
blockEntries.desc: If disabled then forwarding requests are always considered to be successful, errors are ignored.

blockEntries.name: iterators
blockEntries.desc: Use iterators to execute query, as opposed to fully materialising the series in memory.

blockEntries.name: batch_iterators
blockEntries.desc: Use batch iterators to execute query, as opposed to fully materialising the series in memory.  Takes precedent over the -querier.iterators flag.

blockEntries.name: query_ingesters_within
blockEntries.desc: Maximum lookback beyond which queries are not sent to ingester. 0 means all queries are sent to ingester.

blockEntries.name: query_store_after
blockEntries.desc: The time after which a metric should be queried from storage and not just ingesters. 0 means all queries are sent to store. If this option is enabled, the time range of the query sent to the store-gateway will be manipulated to ensure the query end is not more recent than 'now - query-store-after'.

blockEntries.name: max_query_into_future
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration into the future you can query. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS for gRPC client connecting to store-gateway.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: shuffle_sharding_ingesters_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Fetch in-memory series from the minimum set of required ingesters, selecting only ingesters which may have received series since -querier.query-ingesters-within. If this setting is false or -querier.query-ingesters-within is '0', queriers always query all ingesters (ingesters shuffle sharding on read path is disabled).

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent queries. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The timeout for a query. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled. This also applies to queries evaluated by the ruler (internally or remotely).

blockEntries.name: max_samples
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of samples a single query can load into memory. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: default_evaluation_interval
blockEntries.desc: The default evaluation interval or step size for subqueries. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: lookback_delta
blockEntries.desc: Time since the last sample after which a time series is considered stale and ignored by expression evaluations. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled). This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: replication_factor
blockEntries.desc: Number of ingesters that each time series is replicated to. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: zone_awareness_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: excluded_zones
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: tokens_file_path
blockEntries.desc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

blockEntries.name: num_tokens
blockEntries.desc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring. Default is auto-detected.

blockEntries.name: instance_availability_zone
blockEntries.desc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

blockEntries.name: unregister_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming.

blockEntries.name: observe_period
blockEntries.desc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

blockEntries.name: min_ready_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

blockEntries.name: final_sleep
blockEntries.desc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

blockEntries.name: readiness_check_ring_health
blockEntries.desc: When enabled the readiness probe succeeds only after all instances are ACTIVE and healthy in the ring, otherwise only the instance itself is checked. This option should be disabled if in your cluster multiple instances can be rolled out simultaneously, otherwise rolling updates may be slowed down.

blockEntries.name: metadata_retain_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which metadata we have not seen will remain in memory before being deleted.

blockEntries.name: rate_update_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to update the per-tenant ingestion rates.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable tracking of active series and export them as metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_update_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to update active series metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After what time a series is considered to be inactive.

blockEntries.name: active_series_custom_trackers
blockEntries.desc: [Deprecated] This config has been moved to the limits config, please set it there. Additional custom trackers for active metrics. If there are active series matching a provided matcher (map value), the count will be exposed in the custom trackers metric labeled using the tracker name (map key). Zero valued counts are not exposed (and removed when they go back to zero).
blockEntries.fieldType: map of tracker name (string) to matcher (string)

blockEntries.name: tsdb_config_update_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to update the per-tenant TSDB configuration.

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that ingester will accept. This limit is per-ingester, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Max tenants that this ingester can hold. Requests from additional tenants will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_series
blockEntries.desc: Max series that this ingester can hold (across all tenants). Requests to create additional series will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this ingester can handle (across all tenants). Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: ignore_series_limit_for_metric_names
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of metric names, for which the -ingester.max-global-series-per-metric limit will be ignored. Does not affect the -ingester.max-global-series-per-user limit.

blockEntries.name: exit_after_flush
blockEntries.desc: Stop after flush has finished. If false, process will keep running, doing nothing.

blockEntries.name: request_rate
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant request rate limit in requests per second. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: request_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant allowed request burst size. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant ingestion rate limit in samples per second.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant allowed ingestion burst size (in number of samples).

blockEntries.name: accept_ha_samples
blockEntries.desc: Flag to enable, for all tenants, handling of samples with external labels identifying replicas in an HA Prometheus setup.

blockEntries.name: ha_cluster_label
blockEntries.desc: Prometheus label to look for in samples to identify a Prometheus HA cluster.

blockEntries.name: ha_replica_label
blockEntries.desc: Prometheus label to look for in samples to identify a Prometheus HA replica.

blockEntries.name: ha_max_clusters
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of clusters that HA tracker will keep track of for a single tenant. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: drop_labels
blockEntries.desc: This flag can be used to specify label names that to drop during sample ingestion within the distributor and can be repeated in order to drop multiple labels.

blockEntries.name: max_label_name_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for label names

blockEntries.name: max_label_value_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for label value. This setting also applies to the metric name

blockEntries.name: max_label_names_per_series
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of label names per series.

blockEntries.name: max_metadata_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for metric metadata. Metadata refers to Metric Name, HELP and UNIT.

blockEntries.name: creation_grace_period
blockEntries.desc: Controls how far into the future incoming samples are accepted compared to the wall clock. Any sample with timestamp `t` will be rejected if `t > (now + validation.create-grace-period)`.

blockEntries.name: enforce_metadata_metric_name
blockEntries.desc: Enforce every metadata has a metric name.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size used by shuffle-sharding. Must be set both on ingesters and distributors. 0 disables shuffle sharding.

blockEntries.name: metric_relabel_configs
blockEntries.desc: List of metric relabel configurations. Note that in most situations, it is more effective to use metrics relabeling directly in the Prometheus server, e.g. remote_write.write_relabel_configs.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per tenant, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per metric name, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active metrics with metadata per tenant, across the cluster. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of metadata per metric, across the cluster. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_exemplars_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of exemplars in memory, across the cluster. 0 to disable exemplars ingestion.

blockEntries.name: active_series_custom_trackers
blockEntries.desc: Additional custom trackers for active metrics. If there are active series matching a provided matcher (map value), the count will be exposed in the custom trackers metric labeled using the tracker name (map key). Zero valued counts are not exposed (and removed when they go back to zero).
blockEntries.fieldType: map of tracker name (string) to matcher (string)

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_time_window
blockEntries.desc: Non-zero value enables out-of-order support for most recent samples that are within the time window in relation to the following two conditions: (1) The newest sample for that time series, if it exists. For example, within [series.maxTime-timeWindow, series.maxTime]). (2) The TSDB's maximum time, if the series does not exist. For example, within [db.maxTime-timeWindow, db.maxTime]). The ingester will need more memory as a factor of rate of out-of-order samples being ingested and the number of series that are getting out-of-order samples.

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunks_per_query
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of chunks that can be fetched in a single query from ingesters and long-term storage. This limit is enforced in the querier, ruler and store-gateway. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_series_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of unique series for which a query can fetch samples from each ingesters and storage. This limit is enforced in the querier and ruler. 0 to disable

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunk_bytes_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of all chunks in bytes that a query can fetch from each ingester and storage. This limit is enforced in the querier and ruler. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_lookback
blockEntries.desc: Limit how long back data (series and metadata) can be queried, up until <lookback> duration ago. This limit is enforced in the query-frontend, querier and ruler. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail but will be manipulated to only query data within the allowed time range. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the query time range (end - start time). This limit is enforced in the query-frontend (on the received query), in the querier (on the query possibly split by the query-frontend) and ruler. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of split (by time) or partial (by shard) queries that will be scheduled in parallel by the query-frontend for a single input query. This limit is introduced to have a fairer query scheduling and avoid a single query over a large time range saturating all available queriers.

blockEntries.name: max_labels_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the time range (end - start time) of series, label names and values queries. This limit is enforced in the querier. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail but will be manipulated to only query data within the allowed time range. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_cache_freshness
blockEntries.desc: Most recent allowed cacheable result per-tenant, to prevent caching very recent results that might still be in flux.

blockEntries.name: max_queriers_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of queriers that can handle requests for a single tenant. If set to 0 or value higher than number of available queriers, *all* queriers will handle requests for the tenant. Each frontend (or query-scheduler, if used) will select the same set of queriers for the same tenant (given that all queriers are connected to all frontends / query-schedulers). This option only works with queriers connecting to the query-frontend / query-scheduler, not when using downstream URL.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_total_shards
blockEntries.desc: The amount of shards to use when doing parallelisation via query sharding by tenant. 0 to disable query sharding for tenant. Query sharding implementation will adjust the number of query shards based on compactor shards. This allows querier to not search the blocks which cannot possibly have the series for given query shard.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_max_sharded_queries
blockEntries.desc: The max number of sharded queries that can be run for a given received query. 0 to disable limit.

blockEntries.name: cardinality_analysis_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables endpoints used for cardinality analysis.

blockEntries.name: label_names_and_values_results_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of distinct label names and values. When querier receives response from ingester, it merges the response with responses from other ingesters. This maximum size limit is applied to the merged(distinct) results. If the limit is reached, an error is returned.

blockEntries.name: label_values_max_cardinality_label_names_per_request
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of label names allowed to be queried in a single /api/v1/cardinality/label_values API call.

blockEntries.name: ruler_evaluation_delay_duration
blockEntries.desc: Duration to delay the evaluation of rules to ensure the underlying metrics have been pushed.

blockEntries.name: ruler_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size when sharding is used by ruler. Value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant, and tenant rules will be sharded across all ruler replicas.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rules_per_rule_group
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rules per rule group per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rule_groups_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rule groups per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: store_gateway_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size, used when store-gateway sharding is enabled. Value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant, that is all tenant blocks are sharded across all store-gateway replicas.

blockEntries.name: compactor_blocks_retention_period
blockEntries.desc: Delete blocks containing samples older than the specified retention period. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: compactor_split_and_merge_shards
blockEntries.desc: The number of shards to use when splitting blocks. 0 to disable splitting.

blockEntries.name: compactor_split_groups
blockEntries.desc: Number of groups that blocks for splitting should be grouped into. Each group of blocks is then split separately. Number of output split shards is controlled by -compactor.split-and-merge-shards.

blockEntries.name: compactor_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: Max number of compactors that can compact blocks for single tenant. 0 to disable the limit and use all compactors.

blockEntries.name: compactor_partial_block_deletion_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a partial block (unfinished block without meta.json file) hasn't been modified for this time, it will be marked for deletion. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: compactor_block_upload_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable block upload API for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_type
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption type. Required to enable server-side encryption overrides for a specific tenant. If not set, the default S3 client settings are used.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS Key ID. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS encryption context. If unset and the key ID override is set, the encryption context will not be provided to S3. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_cidr_networks
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of network CIDRs to block in Alertmanager receiver integrations.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_private_addresses
blockEntries.desc: True to block private and local addresses in Alertmanager receiver integrations. It blocks private addresses defined by  RFC 1918 (IPv4 addresses) and RFC 4193 (IPv6 addresses), as well as loopback, local unicast and local multicast addresses.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant rate limit for sending notifications from Alertmanager in notifications/sec. 0 = rate limit disabled. Negative value = no notifications are allowed.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit_per_integration
blockEntries.desc: Per-integration notification rate limits. Value is a map, where each key is integration name and value is a rate-limit (float). On command line, this map is given in JSON format. Rate limit has the same meaning as -alertmanager.notification-rate-limit, but only applies for specific integration. Allowed integration names: webhook, email, pagerduty, opsgenie, wechat, slack, victorops, pushover, sns.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_config_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of configuration file for Alertmanager that tenant can upload via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_templates_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of templates in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_template_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of single template in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_dispatcher_aggregation_groups
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of aggregation groups in Alertmanager's dispatcher that a tenant can have. Each active aggregation group uses single goroutine. When the limit is reached, dispatcher will not dispatch alerts that belong to additional aggregation groups, but existing groups will keep working properly. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of alerts that a single tenant can have. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum total size of alerts that a single tenant can have, alert size is the sum of the bytes of its labels, annotations and generatorURL. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: forwarding_rules
blockEntries.desc: Rules based on which the Distributor decides whether a metric should be forwarded to an alternative remote_write API endpoint.

blockEntries.name: frontend_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of the query-frontend component, in host:port format. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of the query-scheduler component, in host:port format. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

blockEntries.name: dns_lookup_duration
blockEntries.desc: How often to query DNS for query-frontend or query-scheduler address.

blockEntries.name: id
blockEntries.desc: Querier ID, sent to the query-frontend to identify requests from the same querier. Defaults to hostname.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: log_queries_longer_than
blockEntries.desc: Log queries that are slower than the specified duration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to < 0 to enable on all queries.

blockEntries.name: max_body_size
blockEntries.desc: Max body size for downstream prometheus.

blockEntries.name: query_stats_enabled
blockEntries.desc: False to disable query statistics tracking. When enabled, a message with some statistics is logged for every query.

blockEntries.name: max_outstanding_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per frontend; requests beyond this error with HTTP 429.

blockEntries.name: querier_forget_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a querier disconnects without sending notification about graceful shutdown, the query-frontend will keep the querier in the tenant's shard until the forget delay has passed. This feature is useful to reduce the blast radius when shuffle-sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: DNS hostname used for finding query-schedulers.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_dns_lookup_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to resolve the scheduler-address, in order to look for new query-scheduler instances.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_worker_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of concurrent workers forwarding queries to single query-scheduler.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address. This address is sent to query-scheduler and querier, which uses it to send the query response back to query-frontend.

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise to the querier (via scheduler) (default is auto-detected from network interfaces).

blockEntries.name: port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise to querier (via scheduler) (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: split_queries_by_interval
blockEntries.desc: Split queries by an interval and execute in parallel. You should use a multiple of 24 hours to optimize querying blocks. 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: align_queries_with_step
blockEntries.desc: Mutate incoming queries to align their start and end with their step.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for query-frontend results cache, if not empty. Supported values: [memcached].

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: compression
blockEntries.desc: Enable cache compression, if not empty. Supported values are: snappy.

blockEntries.name: cache_results
blockEntries.desc: Cache query results.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of retries for a single request; beyond this, the downstream error is returned.

blockEntries.name: parallelize_shardable_queries
blockEntries.desc: True to enable query sharding.

blockEntries.name: cache_unaligned_requests
blockEntries.desc: Cache requests that are not step-aligned.

blockEntries.name: downstream_url
blockEntries.desc: URL of downstream Prometheus.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use. Supported backends are: s3, gcs, azure, swift, filesystem.

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: S3 bucket name

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: S3 secret access key

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 access key ID

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: type
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to S3 via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.name: tls_handshake_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: expect_continue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: GCS bucket name

blockEntries.name: service_account
blockEntries.desc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic: 
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

blockEntries.name: account_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account name

blockEntries.name: account_key
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account key

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage container name

blockEntries.name: endpoint_suffix
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN. If set to empty string, default endpoint suffix is used.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

blockEntries.name: msi_resource
blockEntries.desc: If set, this URL is used instead of https://<storage-account-name>.<endpoint-suffix> for obtaining ServicePrincipalToken from MSI.

blockEntries.name: user_assigned_id
blockEntries.desc: User assigned identity. If empty, then System assigned identity is used.

blockEntries.name: auth_version
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

blockEntries.name: auth_url
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift username.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: user_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift API key.

blockEntries.name: domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: project_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

blockEntries.name: project_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

blockEntries.name: region_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Max retries on requests error.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Local filesystem storage directory.

blockEntries.name: storage_prefix
blockEntries.desc: Prefix for all objects stored in the backend storage. For simplicity, it may only contain digits and English alphabet letters.

blockEntries.name: sync_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store synchronized TSDB index headers. This directory is not required to be persisted between restarts, but it's highly recommended in order to improve the store-gateway startup time.

blockEntries.name: sync_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to scan the bucket, or to refresh the bucket index (if enabled), in order to look for changes (new blocks shipped by ingesters and blocks deleted by retention or compaction).

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent queries to execute against the long-term storage. The limit is shared across all tenants.

blockEntries.name: tenant_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent tenants synching blocks.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent blocks synching per tenant.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from object storage per tenant.

blockEntries.name: consistency_delay
blockEntries.desc: Minimum age of a block before it's being read. Set it to safe value (e.g 30m) if your object storage is eventually consistent. GCS and S3 are (roughly) strongly consistent.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: The index cache backend type. Supported values: inmemory, memcached.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of in-memory index cache used to speed up blocks index lookups (shared between all tenants).

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for chunks cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: subrange_size
blockEntries.desc: Size of each subrange that bucket object is split into for better caching.

blockEntries.name: max_get_range_requests
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of sub-GetRange requests that a single GetRange request can be split into when fetching chunks. Zero or negative value = unlimited number of sub-requests.

blockEntries.name: attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching object attributes for chunks. If the metadata cache is configured, attributes will be stored under this cache backend, otherwise attributes are stored in the chunks cache backend.

blockEntries.name: attributes_in_memory_max_items
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of object attribute items to keep in a first level in-memory LRU cache. Metadata will be stored and fetched in-memory before hitting the cache backend. 0 to disable the in-memory cache.

blockEntries.name: subrange_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching individual chunks subranges.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for metadata cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: tenants_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of tenants in the bucket.

blockEntries.name: tenant_blocks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of blocks for each tenant.

blockEntries.name: chunks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of chunks for a block.

blockEntries.name: metafile_exists_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile exists. Also used for tenant deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_doesnt_exist_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile doesn't exist. Also used for tenant deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the metafile.

blockEntries.name: metafile_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of metafile content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: metafile_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block metafile.

blockEntries.name: block_index_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of bucket index content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: ignore_deletion_mark_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which the blocks marked for deletion will be filtered out while fetching blocks. The idea of ignore-deletion-marks-delay is to ignore blocks that are marked for deletion with some delay. This ensures store can still serve blocks that are meant to be deleted but do not have a replacement yet.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, queriers and store-gateways discover blocks by reading a bucket index (created and updated by the compactor) instead of periodically scanning the bucket.

blockEntries.name: update_on_error_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently a bucket index, which previously failed to load, should be tried to load again. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long a unused bucket index should be cached. Once this timeout expires, the unused bucket index is removed from the in-memory cache. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: max_stale_period
blockEntries.desc: The maximum allowed age of a bucket index (last updated) before queries start failing because the bucket index is too old. The bucket index is periodically updated by the compactor, and this check is enforced in the querier (at query time).

blockEntries.name: ignore_blocks_within
blockEntries.desc: Blocks with minimum time within this duration are ignored, and not loaded by store-gateway. Useful when used together with -querier.query-store-after to prevent loading young blocks, because there are usually many of them (depending on number of ingesters) and they are not yet compacted. Negative values or 0 disable the filter.

blockEntries.name: max_chunk_pool_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of a chunks pool, used to reduce memory allocations. The pool is shared across all tenants. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: chunk_pool_min_bucket_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Size - in bytes - of the smallest chunks pool bucket.

blockEntries.name: chunk_pool_max_bucket_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Size - in bytes - of the largest chunks pool bucket.

blockEntries.name: series_hash_cache_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of the in-memory series hash cache. The cache is shared across all tenants and it's used only when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: index_header_lazy_loading_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, store-gateway will lazy load an index-header only once required by a query.

blockEntries.name: index_header_lazy_loading_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If index-header lazy loading is enabled and this setting is > 0, the store-gateway will offload unused index-headers after 'idle timeout' inactivity.

blockEntries.name: partitioner_max_gap_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of a gap for which the partitioner aggregates together two bucket GET object requests.

blockEntries.name: postings_offsets_in_mem_sampling
blockEntries.desc: Controls what is the ratio of postings offsets that the store will hold in memory.

blockEntries.name: map_populate_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, the store-gateway will attempt to pre-populate the file system cache when memory-mapping index-header files.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store TSDBs (including WAL) in the ingesters. This directory is required to be persisted between restarts.

blockEntries.name: block_ranges_period
blockEntries.desc: TSDB blocks range period.

blockEntries.name: retention_period
blockEntries.desc: TSDB blocks retention in the ingester before a block is removed, relative to the newest block written for the tenant. This should be larger than the -blocks-storage.tsdb.block-ranges-period, -querier.query-store-after and large enough to give store-gateways and queriers enough time to discover newly uploaded blocks.

blockEntries.name: ship_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently the TSDB blocks are scanned and new ones are shipped to the storage. 0 means shipping is disabled.

blockEntries.name: ship_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently shipping blocks to the storage.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently ingesters try to compact TSDB head. Block is only created if data covers smallest block range. Must be greater than 0 and max 5 minutes.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently compacting TSDB head into a new block

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB head is idle for this duration, it is compacted. Note that up to 25% jitter is added to the value to avoid ingesters compacting concurrently. 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_write_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The write buffer size used by the head chunks mapper. Lower values reduce memory utilisation on clusters with a large number of tenants at the cost of increased disk I/O operations.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_end_time_variance
blockEntries.desc: How much variance (as percentage between 0 and 1) should be applied to the chunk end time, to spread chunks writing across time. Doesn't apply to the last chunk of the chunk range. 0 means no variance.

blockEntries.name: stripe_size
blockEntries.desc: The number of shards of series to use in TSDB (must be a power of 2). Reducing this will decrease memory footprint, but can negatively impact performance.

blockEntries.name: wal_compression_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable TSDB WAL compression.

blockEntries.name: wal_segment_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: TSDB WAL segments files max size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: flush_blocks_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: True to flush blocks to storage on shutdown. If false, incomplete blocks will be reused after restart.

blockEntries.name: close_idle_tsdb_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB has not received any data for this duration, and all blocks from TSDB have been shipped, TSDB is closed and deleted from local disk. If set to positive value, this value should be equal or higher than -querier.query-ingesters-within flag to make sure that TSDB is not closed prematurely, which could cause partial query results. 0 or negative value disables closing of idle TSDB.

blockEntries.name: memory_snapshot_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: True to enable snapshotting of in-memory TSDB data on disk when shutting down.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_write_queue_size
blockEntries.desc: The size of the write queue used by the head chunks mapper. Lower values reduce memory utilisation at the cost of potentially higher ingest latency. Value of 0 switches chunks mapper to implementation without a queue. This flag is only used if the new chunk disk mapper is enabled with -blocks-storage.tsdb.new-chunk-disk-mapper.

blockEntries.name: new_chunk_disk_mapper
blockEntries.desc: Temporary flag to select whether to use the new (used in upstream Prometheus) or the old (legacy) chunk disk mapper.

blockEntries.name: isolation_enabled
blockEntries.desc: [Deprecated] Enables TSDB isolation feature. Disabling may improve performance.

blockEntries.name: series_hash_cache_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of the in-memory series hash cache. The cache is shared across all tenants and it's used only when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: max_tsdb_opening_concurrency_on_startup
blockEntries.desc: limit the number of concurrently opening TSDB's on startup

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_capacity_min
blockEntries.desc: Minimum capacity for out-of-order chunks, in samples between 0 and 255.

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_capacity_max
blockEntries.desc: Maximum capacity for out of order chunks, in samples between 1 and 255.

blockEntries.name: block_ranges
blockEntries.desc: List of compaction time ranges.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when downloading blocks for compaction and uploading resulting blocks.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from the long term storage.

blockEntries.name: consistency_delay
blockEntries.desc: Minimum age of fresh (non-compacted) blocks before they are being processed.

blockEntries.name: data_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to temporarily store blocks during compaction. This directory is not required to be persisted between restarts.

blockEntries.name: compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: The frequency at which the compaction runs

blockEntries.name: compaction_retries
blockEntries.desc: How many times to retry a failed compaction within a single compaction run.

blockEntries.name: compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent compactions running.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently compactor should run blocks cleanup and maintenance, as well as update the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of tenants for which blocks cleanup and maintenance should run concurrently.

blockEntries.name: deletion_delay
blockEntries.desc: Time before a block marked for deletion is deleted from bucket. If not 0, blocks will be marked for deletion and compactor component will permanently delete blocks marked for deletion from the bucket. If 0, blocks will be deleted straight away. Note that deleting blocks immediately can cause query failures.

blockEntries.name: tenant_cleanup_delay
blockEntries.desc: For tenants marked for deletion, this is time between deleting of last block, and doing final cleanup (marker files, debug files) of the tenant.

blockEntries.name: max_compaction_time
blockEntries.desc: Max time for starting compactions for a single tenant. After this time no new compactions for the tenant are started before next compaction cycle. This can help in multi-tenant environments to avoid single tenant using all compaction time, but also in single-tenant environments to force new discovery of blocks more often. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: max_opening_blocks_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of goroutines opening blocks before compaction.

blockEntries.name: max_closing_blocks_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of blocks that can be closed concurrently during split compaction. Note that closing of newly compacted block uses a lot of memory for writing index.

blockEntries.name: symbols_flushers_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of symbols flushers used when doing split compaction.

blockEntries.name: enabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that can be compacted. If specified, only these tenants will be compacted by compactor, otherwise all tenants can be compacted. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: disabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that cannot be compacted by this compactor. If specified, and compactor would normally pick given tenant for compaction (via -compactor.enabled-tenants or sharding), it will be ignored instead.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which compactors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_min_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum time to wait for ring stability at startup. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_max_duration
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for ring stability at startup. If the compactor ring keeps changing after this period of time, the compactor will start anyway.

blockEntries.name: instance_id
